Case reference: 2014004773.CaseDesc: On August 10, 2000, Bassel El Youssef was seen for the last time when he left his mother’s residence in the Saint-Léonard District of Montreal, Quebec. Bassel has not been seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2014005121.CaseDesc: On May 10, 2008, Marie Claude Chrétien spent part of the evening at home building a campfire with neighbours. She was last seen by her next-door neighbour at around 11:30 p.m. No one has had any contact with her since and Marie Claude left no message or clue as to her whereabouts.

Teeth: False, Upper dental prosthetic and natural lower teeth

Case reference: 2016044292.CaseDesc: Chenel Dubé was last seen on August 10, 1970 in Montreal, Quebec. That evening, he called his mother to tell her that he would be home later. Chenel's vehicle was found 3 days later in the parking lot of a restaurant in Ville Saint-Laurent, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014001607.CaseDesc: On August 4, 1979, Joseph Cohen was seen for the last time in Montreal. It was a Saturday night, he was out with friends at the Blanche Neige restaurant located in Côte-des-Neiges. His vehicle was located in a parking lot facing Valois Road.

Case reference: 2012020165.CaseDesc: The remains of this male were found in a forested area immediately north of the Port Coquitlam cemetery.

Teeth: Visible Decay, Missing an upper front tooth on the left side prior to death. The upper front tooth on the right side was angled.
Deformity: Left Knee, Osgoode-Schlatter's disease - bony bump on shin below knee

Case reference: 2014005439.CaseDesc: John Sparrow was last seen in April or May of 2001, getting into an early 1990s black Chevrolet pick-up truck while accompanied by an unknown male driver. Mr. Sparrow and the unknown man left the parking lot of the Denny's restaurant located at Benson Ave and Division St, in the city of Kingston, Ontario and headed north past highway #401.

Case reference: 2014016821.CaseDesc: On July 6, 2014, at approximately 7:00 a.m., Wally Giesbrecht went for a walk from a local motel on the 16 Highway bypass in North Battleford, Saskatchewan. When he did not return to the hotel, his family searched the area, including the shoreline of the North Saskatchewan River and Finlayson Island's pedestrian trails with the assistance of the North Battleford RCMP, while the Fire Department conducted a water-based search of the river, all to no avail.

Shirt: Cloth, Grey, Car logo on back
Sweater: Black, Hoodie with a possible logo

Case reference: 2012020658.CaseDesc: On November 13, 1993, Joyce Tillotson was last seen in Regina, Saskatchewan, when she left her residence to visit a friend. She never arrived at her friend’s home. Joyce was originally from the Carry The Kettle First Nation near Indian Head in Saskatchewan.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, "TR" text on bicep

Case reference: 2016064545.CaseDesc: On May 17, 2007, skeletal remains of a man were discovered in a farmer's field near the Athabasca River. It is possible that these remains came from the river. This individual did not have any upper teeth and likely wore dentures. The sacrum was deformed and there is a possibility that he walked with a limp.

Case reference: 2018064370.CaseDesc: On November 8, 2018, at approximately 8:30 am, Artur Mis was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Artur did not show up for work on November 9 and 12th, and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2006007299.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1985, Byron Simmons and Julie Ann Schneider were observed fishing from a boat in Lake Huron. They were near the Nuclear Power Generation Station, near Inverhuron, Ontario, in the outflow from the nuclear plant. The couple failed to return to their cottage and are presumed drowned.  Their boat was recovered the following spring washed up on shore to the north, near Oliphant, Ontario.

Hair: Grey, White, Other, Short, Afro style

Case reference: 2014003956.CaseDesc: Mary Louise Lejeune was last seen on February 23, 1991 in Montreal, Quebec. She left without notifying her family and she has not been heard from since.

Coat: Wool, Grey, Purple collar and wrists

Case reference: 2014006218.CaseDesc: Lori Kasprick, who sometimes went by "Lovey", was last seen in the mid-1970s.  She was from Hilliard and going to school in Mundare when last seen.  Lori may have had ties to Tofield and Ryley.  Her grandparents lived in Holden at that time, and Lori could have made acquaintance with others her age when going to visit.

Case reference: 2020010776.CaseDesc: On July 25, 1968, Samuel Hall was seen for the last time when he went out onto Lake Ontario for a fishing trip. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Shirt: Blue, Grey, Work, Emblem with the letters "BA"

Case reference: 2021001787.CaseDesc: On January 10, 2021, Sébastien Lavallée was seen for the last time when he left his residence. Sébastien had mentioned that he was going to go for a walk on the lake in the ‘MRC des Deux-Montagnes’ in Quebec. During the time of his disappearance, Sébastien was engaged in a high-risk lifestyle, and was suffering from mental health problems.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Implant retained dentures, upper and lower

Case reference: 2014005806.CaseDesc: Roderic Maynard was last seen on Salt Spring Island, BC.  Mr. Maynard had personal issues and departed the area telling friends he intended on attending rehab for treatment of alcohol abuse.  Mr. Maynard is an avid sailor and has travelled all over the world.  Mr. Maynard was employed operating ferries around the Vancouver/Victoria area and would have no problem finding employment operating large water vessels or sail boats.  He is familiar with sailing all around the world and planned to retire in the St. Maarten area.

Mark: Left Cheek, large mole under eye

Case reference: 2018040276.CaseDesc: On November 2, 1992, at approximately 12:00pm, Luom Truong was last seen leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to leaving his home, Luom and his mother had an argument.

Case reference: 2005002199.CaseDesc: On April 19, 1980, a Caucasian male was found at a campsite (Lot 19, Con 8, Peck Township) on Hardwood Lookout Trail in Algonquin Park. The death is estimated to have occurred between July 1, 1971 and Spring 1978.

Hair: Blonde, Long, Possibly in a ponytail
Belt: 36 inch, wear shown at 32 inch hole
Other: A folding camp stove; and an aluminum camper's pot with a lid
A black down-filled sleeping bag with a nylon outer shell
Wallet: Black, with 8 cent stamp issues between July 1, 1971 and September 1, 1976

Case reference: 2020028767.CaseDesc: In the late evening of August 24, 1975, Jean-Marc Meagher was seen for the last time in Berthierville, Quebec.

Case reference: 2021022385.CaseDesc: On May 28, 2021, Kienan Tran was reported missing from his residence in West St. Paul, Manitoba. In May, a representative from property management entered Kienan’s residence and noticed that it was vacant. Additional details revealed that Kienan was engaged in a high-risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2014001111.CaseDesc: On February 7th, 1994, the remains of an adult male (25-50 years old), 5'10-6'0 tall, with a thin build, were located by land surveying students in a wooded area near the village of Anmore. The investigation determined the cause of death to be a self-inflicted gunshot wound. A black guitar case was found near the remains. He went missing sometime after May 1992.

Belt: Black, Blue, Fabric belt with a metal Indian Chief Belt buckle inscribed "HARA"
Jacket: Cotton, Blue, Blue with Green Gold piping sleeved Windbreaker Jacket
Pants: Nylon, Blue, Maroon, Sweat pants with zipper on cuffs
Shirt: Cotton, Grey, Black, Long Sleeved Sweatshirt

Case reference: 2016055037.CaseDesc: Human remains were found on May 10, 2006 in a field near Mossleigh, AB. They are believed to be those of a female, over the age of 40, possibly of Caucasian or Indigenous descent, who was between 5’2” and 5’6”. The individual was missing teeth and likely wore an upper denture. The individual may have complained of joint pain due to arthritis. The remains appear to have been there from 1 to 5 years.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Cheek, Healed fracture of right cheek bone
Mark: Right Side Of Head, Large button osteoma on right side of forehead

Case reference: 2006021799.CaseDesc: Leo Payash, aged 8, was last seen on July 01, 1957. He and his mother Cecilia Payash, aged 48 years, were walking on Red Lake Road and neither has been seen since.

Deformity: Nose, Described as having a "hooked" nose

Case reference: 2013000093.CaseDesc: On July 10, 1989, Arlene Gagne was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Arlene told her husband that she wanted to stay home for the day. When her husband came back, Arlene was not home. All of her personal belongings were left at home.

Case reference: 2014005313.CaseDesc: On September 24, 2007, Azelea Brown last spoke to her mother who was overseas.

Case reference: 2014004896.CaseDesc: On September 22, 2002, Aiqiu Chen was seen for the last time as she was leaving her brother’s home in Toronto, Ontario. Aiqiu left with all of her belongings.

Case reference: 2007003699.CaseDesc: On April 9, 2007, a male was located in a forested area north of the intersection of Fiddlers Green Road and Glancaster Road in the community of Mount Hope, Hamilton. He is believed to have been deceased for 7 to 8 months and possibly longer.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, 2-3 inches in length
Teeth: Visible Missing, Upper teeth were lost or removed prior to death. Remaining teeth include 1 canine and 2 premolar teeth on each side of lower jaw
Money: $12.99 with one discolored coin, unknown denomination
Shirt: Denim, Blue, "Kinswood" brand long sleeved button down shirt, size large

Case reference: 2014001642.CaseDesc: In October of 1983, Edna Smith, 24 years old, was last seen at a camp with two other persons on East Trout Lake located approximately 120 kilometers north of Prince Albert, SK. A search party located the bodies of the two companions, however, she has never been located. A boat the trio had previously used was found capsized in the lake and it was suspected that all three individuals drowned.

Deformity: Mouth, Cleft Palate had been operated on

Case reference: 2012003299.CaseDesc: David Wardle lived alone in Wilberforce, Ontario. He worked off and on at a local mill and kept mostly to himself. During the fall of 1981, Mr. Wardle advised a family member that he had gotten into some trouble and would be leaving for awhile to get it straightened out. Approximately one week later Mr. Wardle and his truck were missing from his home. Family members are concerned for his well-being as his whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014002760.CaseDesc: On June 3, 1976, a witness saw Claude Houle fall from the Laviolette Bridge in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. His body was never recovered.

Case reference: 2014005006.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2007, Sun Jin, her husband Joon Han, and their daughter Il Han were seen for the last time at a school in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005451.CaseDesc: John W. Burton along with two passengers (Clifford Dowson and Edward Flett) were flying from Oxford House to Island Lake. Mr. Burton was the pilot of the Cessna 185. Around 11:00 am Mr. Burton made a routine call stating that the airplane would be landing in Garden Hill in approximately 15 minutes. The airplane did not arrive at its destination. The wreckage and all three on board were never located.

Case reference: 2014005735.CaseDesc: On December 24, 1998, Rostyslav Korolko was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. At the time of his disappearance, Rostyslav was living with his brother and he had told him that he was going to look for work.

Case reference: 2021059908.CaseDesc: On June 16, 2016, the partial remains of an unidentified man were recovered in Renews, Newfoundland. Between 2016 and 2018, additional remains belonging to this man were recovered.

Case reference: 2021023928.CaseDesc: On April 08, 2021, Dale Hallett was last seen at an RBC ATM in Hinton, Alberta.  Dale usually wears sweatpants or coveralls with a long sleeve shirt.

Hair: Grey, Other, Grey hair & moustache, partially balding

Case reference: 2014003554.CaseDesc: On May 30, 1986, Edward Ludwig was seen for the last time as he left his work site at the Bow Valley Provincial Park in Canmore, Alberta. At this time, Edward was on his way to go boating on Lake Minnewanka in Banff National Park in Alberta. His boat was found empty floating on the lake. During the time of his disappearance, Edward was despondent.

Case reference: 2013000004.CaseDesc: John Wade was last seen at his parents home on June 17, 2012 in Halifax, Nova Scotia. He left on foot while distraught, leaving behind his identification, bank card and money. He has been known to reside on the streets and does have connections to Edmonton, Alberta. John has previously hitchhiked across Canada. He suffers with mental illness issues.

Teeth: Good, Upper front tooth is capped

Case reference: 2014005064.CaseDesc: On June 12, 1983, Roy Nippi was last seen on the Chagoness/Kinistin First Nation near Tisdale, Saskatchewan. Roy was known to travel throughout western Canada and the western USA, however, searches and inquiries over the years with contacts in those provinces and states have failed to reveal any trace of Roy.

Case reference: 2012020170.CaseDesc: An adult male was washed up along the south side of the beach at Stanley Park, near the 2000 block of Beach Avenue at English Bay in Vancouver.

Wallet: Black, Contained pliers and a jack knife
Mark: Forehead, Post mortem abrasion on the right side of the forehead

Case reference: 2014001612.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1975, Renée Larose was seen for the last time when she left her home in the borough of Rosemont-La Petite-Patrie in the city of Montreal, Quebec. No one has seen or heard from her since.

Case reference: 2008003399.CaseDesc: William Smith was last seen operating a large boat leaving Port Rowan, Ontario at approximately 5:30 pm on June 23, 1983. The boat was seen heading out to the north channel, which would lead into Lake Erie. The boat is described as a white, 31 foot, 1977 Bertram hardtop cruiser with a flying bridge. The hull VIN number is 3121641B and the boat had twin Mercruiser 330 hp engines.

Case reference: 2005004699.CaseDesc: On September 3, 1995, an unidentified woman was found in the Niagara River, near the Maid of the Mist Dock. She had adenomyosis, similar to endometriosis. She had peach/pink polish on finger and toe nails. She is estimated to have been in the water for a few days.

Teeth: Good condition with a few white fillings. Both lower first molars were extracted before death.
Jeans: Denim, Blue, Levi's Strauss, size 27 waist and 22 inseam
Jewelry: Gold, Gold, wearing a 14" chain with crucifix; European 9K gold; manufacturing mark of "ATS"
Scar: Abdomen, 12 cm surgical scar below the naval

Case reference: 2016034844.CaseDesc: On June 3, 2016, Derwin Beardy was seen for the last time in Winnipeg, Manitoba. During the time of his disappearance, Derwin was leading a transient lifestyle.

Shirt: Cotton, Red, White, Red t-shirt with white lettering across back, white emblem left chest

Case reference: 2014002185.CaseDesc: On May 30, 1977, Géraldine Dufresne was seen for the last time at her residence in the Montréal-Nord district of Montreal, Quebec. Géraldine did not report to work, nor did she inform her employer of her absence. All of her belongings were left in her apartment.

Case reference: 2012020113.CaseDesc: On September 11, 2004, Sylvie Menard was reported missing in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. Sylvie was last seen at approximately 1:00 p.m. in a licensed establishment located at the intersection of 3rd Row and Highway 359 (Main Street) in Saint-Luc-de-Vincennes, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014004849.CaseDesc: In the evening of November 21, 2006, Yves Castonguay left his residence in Bécancour, Gentilly sector. He may have been spotted a few times; however Mr. Castonguay has had no contact with his family since this date. His family have reason to fear for his health and safety.

Case reference: 2005004599.CaseDesc: On August 22, 1996, an unidentified man, believed to be Caucasian was recovered from the Sir Adam Beck Dam in the Niagara River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 145 lbs and his length was measured at 5'10" to 5’11”, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He has evidence of heart disease and may have had heart problems in the past. It is estimated that he had been in the water for a few days up to two weeks prior to discovery. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts that this unidentified male is of European ancestry.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Long, Long grey and white beard 12cm
Teeth: No upper teeth and no lower posterior teeth; remaining teeth have roots only; crowns are lost due to decay.

Case reference: 2022000648.CaseDesc: Murray Marsden went missing from Calgary, Alberta, sometime between April 29, 2010, and December 28, 2021.

Deformity: Left Hand, Left hand fingers are flexed
Scar: Left Eye, Scar located in left eyebrow

Case reference: 2006023099.CaseDesc: Gordon Zeigler was last seen on January 3, 1991, heading to a camp on Elizabeth Lake, Ontario by snowmobile. Although his snowmobile was located on Lake Nipigon, he was never found and is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2012020063.CaseDesc: On June 18, 1966, Kimberley Mclean was seen for the last time in Whiteshell Provincial Park in Rennie, Manitoba. That day, Kimberley and her mother had attended Camp Alloway for a staff picnic.  Upon their arrival, Kimberley changed into her bathing suit and went to the dock area. Five minutes later, Kimberley's mother went down to the dock with some cookies for her daughter, but was unable to find her.

Case reference: 2017013180.CaseDesc: On March 1, 2017, at approximately 9:00 p.m., Maryam Mehrvarz and Kian Norouzian were last seen together in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005579.CaseDesc: In the early hours of January 17, 1991, Darrell Watt was seen for the last time as he left the Beverly Crest Hotel tavern in Edmonton, Alberta. During the time of his disappearance, Darrell was engaged in a high risk lifestyle and was a known associate of a motorcycle club.

Case reference: 2005002499.CaseDesc: On March 23, 1987, a black male was found on the shoreline of the Holly Bay Lodge (Lot 8, Con. 12, Dover Township) in Mitchell's Bay of Lake St. Clair, Wallaceburg. He may have been a smoker. He is believed to have been dead for approximately 8 months.

Money: coins, most recent 1985, distributed after March
Shoes: Blue, Grey, running shoes "Winner" brand, size 8 with velcro fasteners
Socks: Cotton, White, red and blue stripes at the top
Other: May have suffered from lower back pain

Case reference: 2014003667.CaseDesc: On May 23, 1996, at approximately 7:30 p.m., Kevin Lotysz was seen for the last time as he left the McKellar Hospital in Thunder Bay, Ontario. Kevin is an avid drummer and enjoys music.

Mark: Cheek, Birthmark on lower right cheek
Tattoo: Chest, Sword on left side of chest

Case reference: 2014004535.CaseDesc: Jack Fraser was last seen on August 2, 2004 at his place of work in downtown Vancouver. His parents reported him missing as they had not seen or heard from him in over two weeks. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2020020791.CaseDesc: On May 12, 2020, David was supposed to cross into Tucson, Arizona from Nogales, Mexico. Unfortunately, he has not been heard from since. Last contact was made around midnight between May 12 and 13, 2020.

Case reference: 2014005592.CaseDesc: The Timmins Police Service is actively investigating a historical missing person case involving the disappearance of William “Billy” Chookomolin. Mr. Chookomolin went missing from Timmins in the spring of 1995 at the age of 47.

Case reference: 2014004533.CaseDesc: On October 29, 1985, Jonathan Molina was seen for the last time in a vehicle in the White Bear First Nation near Carlyle, Saskatchewan. The following year, on October 1, 1986, the skeletal remains of Jonathan’s mother and infant sibling were found in close proximity of the vehicle. Searches to find Jonathan have been unsuccessful.

Case reference: 2024009413.CaseDesc: On November 08, 2023, a young woman was found sitting on a chair in the bushes near the north end of the Knight St Bridge in Vancouver, British Columbia. She was very thin but otherwise healthy, and died from illicit drug poisoning.

Hair: Brown, Red, Short, Wavy, Brown hair dyed red
Sweater: Cotton, Light Blue, “Old Navy” brand hoodie, size medium
Underwear: Cloth, Dark Blue, “Forever 21” brand bra, size small

Case reference: 2013000073.CaseDesc: Monique Heneault was last seen on June 4, 1986, in Montreal. Mme Heneault lived by herself in an apartment. It seems as though she left her apartment suddenly because there were left overs from her meal found on the table and counter. She had rented a chalet in Labelle, but never arrived.

Case reference: 2014004260.CaseDesc: Louis Valentine was last seen in August 2000 with friends in Laval, Quebec. Louis, a former resident of Laval, had won a large sum of money in the lottery in December 1999 and the following month he moved to Trois-Rivières.

Case reference: 2014005230.CaseDesc: On March 9, 2009, Daniel Moisan was last seen leaving a residence in Victoriaville to go to an acquaintance’s house. Daniel has not been seen since.

Coat: Nylon, Black, Orange, Brand: Harley Davidson

Case reference: 2006020899.CaseDesc: Pooran Shivcharan, age 36, was last seen in an aircraft heading west bound in the direction of Geraldton, Ontario on November 13, 1981. Although he was originally headed toward Thunder Bay, he may have altered his course towards Geraldton or Raith.  Search efforts were unable to locate Mr. Shivcharan or his aircraft.

Case reference: 2009003899.CaseDesc: Investigation revealed that Emile Ruger, who resides on Brookdale Ave., had not paid his rent for the month of March and April 2008.  Mr. Ruger usually pays his rent three days in advance to the month due. He was last seen mid-February 2008 and his whereabouts are unknown. Last Seen: Rooming House on Brookdale Avenue

Case reference: 2014003895.CaseDesc: On April 30, 1993, RCMP were advised Diana Thomas had fallen through the ice and had not surfaced. Diana was a passenger on a ski-doo along with her mother and a 13 year old driver. The threesome had only gone about 10 meters from shore when the back of the ski-doo went into the water, quickly followed by the front. Diana fell into the water with her mother and never resurfaced. Attempts were made to recover Diana, however all efforts met with negative results.

Case reference: 2024011240.CaseDesc: Melanie Lapish was last seen on February 26, 2024, in the town of Fort Frances, Ontario. Melanie has ties to the Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario area.

Tattoo: Lower Back, Tribal tattoo with butterfly, black and white, 102 mm (4 inches)

Case reference: 2014003833.CaseDesc: On September 27, 1975, Barry Kelly was seen for the last time at the Speak-Easy Steakhouse in Niagara Falls, New York, in the United States. He never returned to his Niagara Falls, Ontario, home. At the time of his disappearance, Barry was despondent, and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Jewelry: Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Watch
Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Chain, Around neck
Sweater: Orange, Brown, Hooded, Hooded with stripes

Case reference: 2019070875.CaseDesc: On April 17, 2019, the remains of a woman were found in a crawl space of a triplex in Montreal, Québec.

Case reference: 2019075539.CaseDesc: On November 25, 2019, Daniel REOCH was last seen in Squamish, British Columbia.  Daniel has not been seen or heard from since.

Shirt: Black, Collared Black long sleeve button up shirt with white buttons
Blue, Black, Collared Blue black plaid long sleeve button up shirt worn over
Blue, Brown, Collared Blue brown tan plaid long sleeve shirt worn underneath
Shoes: Black, White, White trim on soles with white laces on left shoe and black laces on right shoe

Case reference: 2023002821.CaseDesc: On January 17 2023, Diego Sarria Franco left his residence in Ottawa, Ontario in his 2018 Volkswagon Atlas and did not return home.  Diego's vehicle was located unoccupied in the area of Maple Avenue North in Pembroke Ontario on January 30.

Sweater: Black, HOODIE, Canada Niagara Falls written on the front

Case reference: 2014003060.CaseDesc: Pierre Lagacé was last seen on January 5, 2003. At the time, he was living in the Ville Lemoyne sector of Longueuil, Québec. Mr. Lagacé was reported missing by a family member. At the time of his disappearance, he had little money and no car in his name.

Case reference: 2014003815.CaseDesc: Monica Cardinal was reported missing to the Edmonton Police Service in February, 1997. Monica was last seen leaving a downtown hotel with an unknown male in June, 1993.

Case reference: 2013000077.CaseDesc: On October 10, 1986, Michael Semergian was seen for the last time in the Outremont District in Montreal, Quebec. Michael has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2013000126.CaseDesc: In December 2007, Bonnie Marie Joseph was reported missing to the Fort St-James RCMP.  Further investigation determined that Miss Joseph was last seen on September 8, 2007 in Vanderhoof, BC.  She led a high risk lifestyle and was known to hitchhike alone between Fort St-James, Vanderhoof and Prince George, BC.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, heart with Mom & Djily

Case reference: 2014001814.CaseDesc: On October 27, 1973, between 2:00pm and 5:00pm Steve Mysick packed a suitcase and left the residence where he was staying, located in Rapid City, Manitoba. Steve Mysick was an outpatient of the Brandon Mental Hospital and had been staying with his friends for 2.5 years at the time of his disappearance.   Mr. Mysick was last seen at the CP train station in Brandon, Manitoba. It is likely Mr. Mysick purchased the ticket to Winnipeg as he had very limited funds available and had lived in Winnipeg in the past. There is no indication if Mr. Mysick actually boarded the train to Winnipeg.   Steve Mysick has never been located and his whereabouts is unknown. Foul play is not suspected.

Case reference: 2014001059.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1970, the body of a heavyset young adult male with black hair was found on the shore of Kamloops Lake in British Columbia. He had all his teeth removed during his life and had no noticeable scars or tattoos. He is believed to have drowned in the Thompson River near Riverside Park a few days earlier.

Jacket: Nylon, Light Blue, Squall brand with hood, golfer label on front with zipper
Shirt: Blue, Yellow, Corsair brand, checkered pattern
Blue, Longsleeve, Lancer Brand, Size Large, Blue with purple and black check pattern, longsleeve
White, Bluestone brand, long sleeves, size medium
Shoes: Brown, Oxfords, Vibram brand, made in Italy, with shoe laces

Case reference: 2010002599.CaseDesc: On the morning of Monday, July 19, 2010, Curtis Barry left his residence on Britannia Avenue in Bradford, to walk his two dogs. He was reported missing when his wife returned home in the late afternoon and discovered he was not home. The dogs were located later the same day wandering the streets approximately 1 km from his residence. Mr. Barry has not been seen since and the dog leash has not been located.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, a ship and names Lauren, John and Cliff on boat
Torso (Back), 3 roses with names of Michelle, Kietan and Kayla

Case reference: 2022009358.CaseDesc: On March 17, 2005, shortly after midnight, Patricia Bessel was last seen leaving her residence in Grand Island, New York. Patricia’s vehicle was subsequently located in a parking lot near the American Falls in Niagara Falls, New York. At the time of her disappearance, Patricia was despondent

Case reference: 2018038616.CaseDesc: On July 9, 2018, Cameron Richard Betker was reported missing by family.

Case reference: 2014001900.CaseDesc: Andre Gauthier was last seen at approximately 10:15 pm the evening of September 23, 1984 near Simms Corner on the west side of Saint John, NB.

Other: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Lighter with "Andre" engraved on the front, "July 10, 1984, Irene + Paul" on the back

Case reference: 2022054292.CaseDesc: Steven Blanchette Rochefort was reported missing on October 26, 2022. The last footprint of life for Steven Blanchette Rochefort was on July 11, 2022, in Calgary, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014002875.CaseDesc: Edmond Belliveau was last seen on Oct 1, 1985, in Saint John, NB.

Case reference: 2015005930.CaseDesc: On January 31st, 2015 Ali Jamil was seen for the last time in the area of Prospect Point, Niagara Falls, New York, USA. At the time of his disappearance, Ali was despondent.

Case reference: 2014019687.CaseDesc: On November 23, 2013, an unidentified partial male skull was found in a forested area along a power line in Anmore near Coquitlam, BC. The decedent has likely been missing for several years.

Deformity: Head, Fractured facial bones. Underwent surgery to his skull, possibly during the 1980s or 1990s

Case reference: 2014004156.CaseDesc: On July 17,1975, Helen Jordan was last seen on a bench outside of 84 South Cumberland Street in Thunder Bay, Ontario. Prior to the time of her disappearance, Helen was known to frequent that area.

Case reference: 2014004812.CaseDesc: Grant MOFFAT attended the Fas Gas outlet at the junction of HWY 5 and PTH 68. Here he purchased a fishing license. MOFFAT was at this location for about 20 minutes and did not seem to be in a hurry. On August 20, 2006 the vehicle belonging to MOFFAT was located on HWY 481 about 3 km west of Crane River. The vehicle had not been reported stolen. The whereabouts of MOFFAT remain unknown.

Case reference: 2006006699.CaseDesc: Eric Larsfolk and John McCormick were last seen playing at the McCormick farm in Caledon. They have not been seen since.

Case reference: 2005001599.CaseDesc: Shawn Jones and Leslie Jones were seen on October 24, 1993. The two boys were hitchhiking from Cape Croker to Wiarton. They were dropped off in downtown Wiarton. Between October 26-28, 1993 Leslie Jones was seen with another male fitting the description of Shawn Jones. They were seen together at the Tim Hortons coffee shop in Owen Sound, Ontario. Shawn Jones was last seen on Berford Street in front of Pacific Hotel. Leslie Jones was last seen in front of the Tim Horton's restaurant on 9th East Street.

Case reference: 2012020031.CaseDesc: Michael Feist's fully operational car was found abandoned near Cherhill, Alberta.  Mr. Feist is known to have well-developed survival skills. Police investigations regarding Mr. Feist's whereabouts are currently ongoing.

Case reference: 2014002218.CaseDesc: On September 18, 1977, Arthur Roy was seen for the last time, at approximately 1400hrs, when he left his home on foot in North Bay, Ontario. Mr. Roy was suffering from a mental illness and was believed to be senile due to old age.

Case reference: 2014006038.CaseDesc: Kimberley Cruickshank was reported missing on March 25, 2013. She was last seen on March 22, 2013 in her apartment on the 2400 Block of Abbott Road in Regina, SK.

Hair: Brown, Red, Straight, Hair is shaved around sides and back with medium length section on the top
Pierce: Ears, 3 piercings on the right side and 1 on the left

Case reference: 2015041172.CaseDesc: Helen Leyden was last in communication with her family between 1968 and 1972. At that time, she was residing in Edmonton, Alberta, but there is a possibility that she relocated to Vancouver, British Columbia, during that period.

Case reference: 2017056443.CaseDesc: Kristina Ward is a 20 years old aboriginal female who has been missing since September 27, 2017. Kristina is schizophrenic and is possibly using drugs. Kristina is developmentally delayed and is described as being vulnerable and easily trust people she does not know.  Kristina has money and a cellphone, however, neither have been used or accessed since September 27, 2017. Kristina was last seen in Surrey at the intersection of 104th Avenue and 144th St. with an unidentified male.

Mark: Upper Lip, Birthmark on upper left lip

Case reference: 2006021899.CaseDesc: De Qian Rang was last seen on April 20, 1992 in the Village of Elora, Ontario. At the time of her disappearance De Qian and her husband operated the 'Abacus Restaurant', south of Elora. An extensive police investigation has failed to locate Mrs. Rang.  Police suspect foul play in her disappearance.

Case reference: 2022037048.CaseDesc: On June 20, 2008, the body of an unidentified man was recovered from Lake Erie, approximately one mile off the north end of Woodlawn Beach in Buffalo, New York.

Jacket: Dark Blue, Brand: Carhartt; size: small
Sweater: Blue, Sweatshirt with cut off sleeves
Blue, Pullover sweater; brand: Mountain Exxpedition

Case reference: 2014005498.CaseDesc: David Rocque was reported missing to the Edmonton Police Service in October 2010.  David was last heard from by a family member in March 2010.  Prior to David's disappearance, he normally maintained contact with his family at least once a month.  He resided in Edmonton but had spent time in northern Alberta, St. Paul area.

Scar: Left Cheek, 51mm close to the eye

Case reference: 2014003594.CaseDesc: On November 12, 1984, Pamela Asprey was last seen getting into a vehicle near the National War Memorial in St. John’s, Newfoundland. The male driver was described as having a large build and wore a baseball hat. That evening, Ms. Asprey had gone to a bar near where she was last seen. She had left her wallet at the bar and had advised her friend that she would be back in twenty minutes. Pamela was known to frequent the Duckwork Street area in St. John’s.

Tattoo: Shoulders, Greek writing on right shoulder

Case reference: 2017023773.CaseDesc: On April 18, 2017 the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Ottawa River near Wendover, Ontario. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this man was either of European ancestry, or Middle Eastern/North African ancestry, or mixed European and Middle Eastern/North ancestry.

Case reference: 2021003909.CaseDesc: On April 6, 2018, Rita Squalli and Maria Squalli were last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Rita and Maria were taken by their father under false pretences, and it is believed that the girls are being kept overseas.
